Most of the world thinks using the word "gypsy" to describe Roma people is more than a bit disrespectful. I suppose if you don't know any "gypsies" or you believe they are only fantastic creatures in Grimm tales.... I wonder if Brits know that they have just titled a movie with something that is about the equivalent of "Big Fat Nigger Gangster" or "Big Fat Kike Gangster". They are doing pretty good with race relations over there, aren't they? Or is that Amsterdam?

rump, you're talking bullshit. 

I'd agree if you were talking about the word "pikey". However, not all gypsies are Roma, and not all Roma are gypsies. I've never known a gypsy who was offended by being referred to as a gypsy. Comparing the word to "nigger" or "kike" is just a big billboard displaying your ignorance for all the world to see.

Yes, I know not all 'gypsies' are Roma.  "I have lots of gypsy friends..." Nice. If you think they are cool with it, then ok. But throughout Eastern Europe they aren't cool with it at all. I wasn't trying to get anyone mad. It isn't like I said anything about puddings and sugary cakes or mushy teeth. Can you even say 'gypsy' with those teeth?

^Your comments would make sense if this film was set amongst the gypsies of Eastern Europe. But it's not. It's set in the UK. As for your bizarre foray into themes of dentistry, well, it just makes you sound confused.  So, sshhh.
